item.name: Search Ride

request.description: Search for available rides. This is a public endpoint (no auth required).
Get detailed information about a specific ride. This is a public endpoint.

query.description: Number of recent searches to return (1-20)

request.description: Get user's recent search history. Requires authentication.
Create an alert to be notified when a matching ride becomes available. Requires authentication.

item.description: APIs for searching and discovering available rides

item.name: Ride Booking

body.raw:
{
    "rideId": "{{ride_id}}",
    "seatsBooked": 2,
    "luggageCount": 1,
    "pickupWaypointId": "{{pickup_waypoint_id}}",
    "dropoffWaypointId": "{{dropoff_waypoint_id}}",
    "notes": "I'll be waiting near the main entrance. Wearing a blue jacket."
}

request.description: Create a new booking for a ride. Pickup and dropoff waypoint IDs are optional - if not provided, origin and destination will be used.

query.description: Filter by status: PENDING, CONFIRMED, CANCELLED, COMPLETED

request.description: Get all bookings for the authenticated user with pagination.
Get details of a specific booking.
Confirm a pending booking. Payment method ID is optional.
Cancel a booking. Only pending or confirmed bookings can be cancelled.

item.description: APIs for booking and managing ride reservations as a passenger

item.name: Publish Ride — Wizard (Redis Draft)

request.description: Step 1: Create a draft ride in Redis with origin location. Returns draft_id (ride_id) for subsequent steps.
Step 2: Set the destination for the draft ride.
Step 3: Compute available route options between origin and destination. Returns array of routes with polyline, distance, and duration.
Step 4: Select one of the computed routes by index. Saves the selected polyline, distance, and duration to the draft.
Step 5: Get famous cities/places along the selected route via Google Places Nearby Search. Includes auto-calculated per-stopper pricing. Requires a route to be selected first (Step 4).
Step 6: Set the stopper points (intermediate stops) for the ride. Use suggestions from Step 5 or add custom locations.
Step 7: Set the departure date and time.
Step 8: Set number of available seats and base price. Vehicle is auto-detected from user profile.

item.name: Step 9: Get Recommended Price (with Stopper Pricing)

request.description: Step 9: Get recommended pricing based on distance and fuel costs. If stopovers are set, also returns per-stopper recommended pricing proportional to distance.
Step 10: Set the final price per seat for the ride.
Step 11: Add optional notes for passengers.
Step 12: Validate and publish the draft ride. Moves data from Redis to PostgreSQL atomically. Requires origin, destination, route, schedule, capacity, and pricing to be set.

item.description:
12-step ride creation wizard. All draft steps use Redis — no DB writes until Publish.

Flow: Origin → Destination → Compute Routes → Select Route → Get Stopper Suggestions → Set Stoppers → Schedule → Capacity → Get Recommended Price → Set Pricing → Notes → Publish

item.name: Publish Ride — Draft Management

request.description: List all draft rides stored in Redis for the authenticated user.
Get the full details of a specific draft ride from Redis.
Delete a draft ride from Redis.

item.description: Manage draft rides stored in Redis

item.name: Publish Ride — Published Rides

request.description: Get list of published rides from PostgreSQL for the authenticated user.
Get details of a specific published ride by its ID.
Cancel a published ride.

item.description: Operations on published rides stored in PostgreSQL
